intro: Heteropterys sanctorum, commonly known as the sacred huito, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, and its structure resembles that of a tree or shrub. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
